column4: I'm using a LiveCD and am trying to copy files from one of my hard drives to my external hard drive but am getting "You do not have permissions to write to this folder."  chmod +x and chown -R haven't worked :/ Help?
well, chmodding +x does nothing for write
you need ntfs-3g to write too, forgot about that
can i do that on a live cd?
I have no idea, but I'm fairly sure not - which limits a livecd's use for rescuing a system
if I formet the ntfs external to ext3, problem solved, right?
oh, you don't care about the files on it?
I don't care about the files on the external
then blow it away, but of course it will only work on Linux/Mac (and windows with a ton of prodding)
you blow the disk away if you don't care about his data
probably a good idea to "shred" it as well
yeah but a little snooping first would be nice.
well yeah, but nothing more can happen to him...
copy over stuff, you'll be able to use ext3 wherever it matters. I have an 80gb fat external, but that's just because I need to use so many windows computers
there's a really great windows driver for reading/writing ext2/3
well, when you work with locked down windows machines...
